name: Lava Grapple Tunnel

blocks.note: Closest Grapple block to the left door

strats.name: Come in Shinecharged, Gain Flash Suit (Spikesuit)
Come in Shinecharging, Gain Flash Suit (Spikesuit)
Come in Shinecharged, Gain Blue Suit (X-Mode)
Come in Shinecharging, Gain Blue Suit (X-Mode)
Grapple
note: To optimize the Grapple swings for minimal heat damage,
1) hold forward and angle-up the entire time,
2) press down to extend Grapple immediately after each Grapple attachment,
3) release Grapple soon after Samus swings past vertical,
4) re-press Grapple as quickly as possible after release.
detailNote: If there is no runway (or only 1 tile) to gain momentum from the neighboring room,
it is faster to begin grappling as quickly as possible, rather than doing a big jump.

strats.name: Speedy Running Space Jump (13-tile runway, closed end)
Suitless Damage Boosts
strats.note: Damage boosts can be used to save energy - delay the damage boost from the spikes slightly in order to rise above the lava before moving.

strats.name: Blue Suit Rapid Damage Boosts with Gravity
note: The presence of the Yapping Maws causes Samus to immediately lose i-frames while moving;
so the damage boosts must be chained directly from one to the next.
This can be done by holding jump the entire time, and releasing right at the end of each boost,
to fall straight down for the next boost, facing left the whole time.
At the end of the final boost, hold left to boost downward, wait for knockback to expire,
then press right to do a buffered turnaround spin jump out of the lava.

strats.name: Blue Suit Rapid Suitless Damage Boosts

requires.notable: Blue Suit Rapid Suitless Damage Boosts

note: The presence of the Yapping Maws causes Samus to immediately lose i-frames while moving;
so the damage boosts must be chained directly from one to the next, with the exception of the first.
Do the first damage boost from far enough left that Samus can land without bringing the first Yapping Maw on camera;
use i-frames to do a spin jump, then chain 4 more damage boosts to cross the room.
This can be done by holding jump the entire time, and releasing right at the end of each boost,
to fall straight down for the next boost, facing left the whole time.
At the end of the final boost, hold left to boost downward, wait for knockback to expire,
then press right to do a buffered turnaround spin jump out of the lava.

strats.name: Tank the Damage with Gravity
strats.note: Speedbooster significantly reduces your jump speed in lava and should be turned off.

strats.name: Gravity SpringBall Bounce (SpeedBooster On)
note: Uses a runway of at least 14 tiles in the adjacent room.
Disable SpeedBooster after jumping so that the lava will not take away all of Samus' momentum.

strats.name: Suitless SpringBall Bounce (SpeedBooster Off)
strats.note: It may help to perform the first jump with HiJump disabled.

strats.name: Suitless SpringBall Bounce (SpeedBooster On)
note: Uses a runway of at least 8 tiles in the adjacent room.
It will help to perform the first jump with HiJump disabled.
Disable SpeedBooster before Samus reaches the lava.

strats.name: Suitless SpringBall Bounce (Long Runway)
note: Uses a runway of at least 21 tiles in the adjacent room.
It will help to perform the first jump with HiJump disabled.
Disable SpeedBooster before Samus reaches the lava.
strats.devNote: SpringFling can be used to extend the last SpringBall bounce so that runway can be shortened, but it mostly inflates the number of strats.

strats.name: Come In Getting Blue, Leave With Temporary Blue (Space Jump)
devNote: The minimum speed $1.A is arbitrary; lower speeds could work with larger heatFrames.
FIXME: set up a mechanism to automate heat frames required in cases like this.

strats.name: Frozen Maw Platforms (Left to Right)
note: While crossing the Spiky Lava, land on frozen Yapping Maws to reduce the number of spike hits needed.
Damage boost towards then freeze the Leftmost enemy as it extends.
Morph and unmorph while above the middle Yapping Maw to land on it just above the lava line.
Ignore the rightmost Yapping Maw.
Delay the damage boost from the spikes slightly in order to rise above the lava before moving.

strats.name: Ceiling Bomb Jump Over Spikes
note: Samus can ceiling bomb jump up gentle slopes.
Going down gentle slopes is also possible but harder, instead an unmorph to reset fall speed is recommended here.

strats.name: G-Mode, Tank the Spikes
devNote: FIXME: Grapple could maybe be used to skip some damage by partially swinging across the room.
Blue suit damage boost options could also be added.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph, Long Ceiling Bomb Jump
note: Samus can ceiling bomb jump up gentle slopes.
Going down gentle slopes is also possible but harder, instead an unmorph to reset fall speed is recommended here.

strats.name: X-Mode Traversal
note: Enter X-mode in the spikes near the door.
Release forward to make Samus move forward at a rate of 1 pixel per frame.
After passing the third Yapping Maw, when Samus appears to move forward,
this is the indication that the camera scroll has locked against the opposite side of the room,
which is a good cue for when to stop, by holding forward again.
To avoid taking another spike hit,
press jump, then release dash to exit X-mode while jumping.

strats.name: Pause Abuse Damage Boosts
note: Pause abuse the spike and lava damage to cross the room while losing minimal Energy.
devNote: Energy ineffeciency is necessary and is represented by extra heatFrames.

strats.name: Grapple
note: To optimize the Grapple swings for minimal heat damage,
1) hold forward and angle-up the entire time,
2) press down to extend Grapple immediately after each Grapple attachment,
3) release Grapple soon after Samus swings past vertical,
4) re-press Grapple as quickly as possible after release.
detailNote: If there is no runway (or only 1 tile) to gain momentum from the neighboring room,
it is faster to begin grappling as quickly as possible, rather than doing a big jump.

strats.name: Speedy Running Space Jump (13-tile runway, closed end)
Suitless Damage Boosts (Right to Left)
strats.note: Damage boosts can be used to save energy - delay the damage boost from the spikes slightly in order to rise above the lava before moving.

strats.name: Blue Suit Rapid Damage Boosts with Gravity
note: The presence of the Yapping Maws causes Samus to immediately lose i-frames while moving;
so the damage boosts must be chained directly from one to the next.
This can be done by holding jump the entire time, and releasing left at the end of each boost
to fall straight down for next boost, facing right the whole time.
At the end of the final boost, Samus should be out of range of the Yapping Maws,
and so should have i-frames to jump normally out of the lava.

strats.name: Blue Suit Rapid Suitless Damage Boosts

requires.notable: Blue Suit Rapid Suitless Damage Boosts

note: The presence of the Yapping Maws causes Samus to immediately lose i-frames while moving;
so the damage boosts must be chained directly from one to the next.
This can be done by holding jump the entire time, and releasing left at the end of each boost,
to fall straight down for the next boost, facing right the whole time.
At the end of the final boost, Samus should be out of range of the Yapping Maws,
and so should have i-frames to jump normally out of the lava.

blocks.note: Closest Grapple block to the right door

strats.name: Come in Shinecharged, Gain Flash Suit (Spikesuit)
Come in Shinecharging, Gain Flash Suit (Spikesuit)
Come in Shinecharged, Gain Blue Suit (X-Mode)

notables.name: Frozen Maw Platforms
note: While crossing the Spiky Lava, land on frozen Yapping Maws to reduce the number of spike hits needed.
Delay the damage boost from the spikes slightly in order to rise above the lava before moving.

notables.name: Suitless Damage Boosts
notables.note: Delay the damage boost from the spikes slightly in order to rise above the lava before moving.

notables.name: Pause Abuse Damage Boosts
note: Pause abuse spike and lava damage to cross the room while losing minimal Energy.

notables.name: Blue Suit Rapid Suitless Damage Boosts
note: Damage boost across the room while carrying a blue suit.
While Yapping Maws are on-camera, Samus' i-frames immediately expire,
meaning Samus must chain the damage boosts directly from one to the next.
Without Gravity, the damage boosts must be slightly delayed in order for Samus to rise above the lava,
and they will occur in quicker succession due to Samus not gaining as much height.

devNote: Add `comeInSpinning` Space Jump strats, with variants for different run speeds.
Add more spring ball bounce variants, for different run speeds and combinations of Gravity and/or HiJump.
